newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIA CRISIL DOWNGRADES ONIDA FINANCE.
newsitem.headline: INDIA CRISIL DOWNGRADES ONIDA FINANCE.

text.p: India's Credit Rating Information Services of India Ltd (CRISIL) said its outstanding rating assigned to the 100-million-rupee non-convertible debenture issue of Onida Finance Limited (OFL) had been downgraded from "BBB" to "BB+" indicating inadequate safety regarding timely payment of interest and principal.

The "FA" rating assigned to the fixed deposit programme has been downgraded to "FB+" indicating that the degree of safety regarding timely payment of interest and principal is inadequate, CRISIL said in a statement on Wednesday.

The revised rating reflects an adverse change in OFL's overall risk profile due to decline in business performance, deterioration of asset quality, increased debt funding of operations which coupled with declining spreads from its fee based operations have resulted in considerable pressure on the profitability of the company, CRISIL said.
